content.question: Which of the following is a feature of the lukasa of the Luba peoples that is derived from the Luba tradition of oral, rather than written, history?

choices.label: The history recorded on the lukasa had to be read the same way in every telling.
The arrangement of each lukasa was determined by each of the experts who used them.
The objects that made up the lukasa had to be periodically adjusted as events occurred.
The lukasa had to be small enough for the person telling the history to hold comfortably.

content.answer: The lukasa had to be small enough for the person telling the history to hold comfortably.
